intro: Proustia cuneifolia f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved proustia, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly serrated edge, giving the plant a unique appearance. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry, sunny areas.
